body:
I recommend using feather, built by Wes and Hadley to solve the problem of transferring data between R and Python efficiently.

Python

import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import feather as ft

df = pd.DataFrame({'N': np.random.randn(5)})
ft.write_dataframe(df, 'df.feather')

R

library(data.table)
library(feather)

dt <- data.table(read_feather("df.feather"))
dt
           N
1: 0.2777700
2: 1.4083377
3: 1.2940691
4: 0.8221348
5: 1.8552908
title: How can I efficiently save a python pandas dataframe in hdf5 and open it as a dataframe in R?
